programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: The divisional round begins with Lamar Jackson and the Ravens hosting C.J. Stroud and the Texans in the AFC. Rookie sensation Stroud led Houston to an overpowering wild-card win against Cleveland. Jackson is expected to win his second MVP.

programme.title: NFL on ESPN Postgame
programme.desc: NFL postgame.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: UFC 297: Strickland vs. du Plessis - Prelims
programme.desc: Gillian Robertson vs. Polyana Viana, strawweight; Serhiy Sidey vs. Ramon Taveras, bantamweight; Charles Jourdain vs. Sean Woodson, featherweight; Brad Katona vs. Garrett Armfield, bantamweight. From Scotiabank Arena in Toronto.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Tyson puts fear into his opponents in this collection of his greatest matches.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Dominating performances from Tyson's early career.

programme.title: Postseason NFL Countdown
programme.desc: A review of the NFL playoffs and a look ahead to the Super Bowl.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Utes complete a homestand when the Ducks visit. Oregon has won 11 in a row, and 20 of the last 21, against Utah, with the lone loss coming in 2017. Jermaine Cousinard (ORE) averaged 14 points and four assists per game against Utah last season.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 10 Tigers try for their 29th straight win at home as they take on the SEC foe Razorbacks. LSU is 11-0 at the Maravich Center this season. The Tigers swept a pair of meetings in 2022-23 behind Angel Reese's total of 49 points and 35 rebounds.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Wake Forest visits North Carolina. The rivals have split the past six meetings after each program defended home court last season. Tar Heels center Armando Bacot averaged 19 points and 10 rebounds in the 2022-23 meetings with the Demon Deacons.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Jayhawks share the floor with a new Big 12 rival in the Bearcats. Kansas has won 14 straight at home, and is 9-0 at the Allen Fieldhouse this season. Hunter Dickinson (KU) has totaled 54 points and 25 rebounds across his last two home dates.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 25 Red Raiders (14-3, 3-1 Big 12) host the No. 20 Cougars (14-3, 2-2). BYU is 3-1 in the all-time series, but Texas Tech took the last matchup in 1995. Texas Tech's nine-game win streak ended with a humbling loss at No. 5 Houston on Jan. 17.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: When Khabib Nurmagomedov retired from MMA, the UFC's lightweight title was up for grabs. See the journey of the 155-pound belt following the Khabib Era, featuring Charles Oliveira, Dustin Poirier, Islam Makhachev, and more.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Green Wave (11-6, 2-3) try to pay back the No. 10 Tigers (15-3, 4-1) in American Athletic Conference play. Tulane claimed both regular-season meetings last season, but Memphis rolled to a 94-54 win in the semifinals of the 2023 AAC Tournament.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Mocs (11-7, 3-2 SoCon) aim to take advantage of the struggling Buccaneers (9-9, 1-4). East Tennessee State has dropped four in a row, though just one loss was at home. Honor Huff (UTC) is posting 15.6 points and 2.9 assists per game this season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: A clash atop the Missouri Valley Conference pits the Racers (8-10, 5-2) against the Sycamores (15-3, 6-1). Murray State has won five of its last six outings to rebound from a 3-9 start to the campaign. The programs split last season's series.

programme.title: Golf
programme.desc: From Santa Maria Golf Club in Panama City, Panama.

programme.desc: A look ahead to exhilarating winter sports action at X Games Aspen 2024.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Aztecs carry a pair of three-game streaks into a matchup with the Spartans. San Diego State has won three in a row in the series after outscoring San Jose State by 45 points across two 2022-23 contests, but has dropped three straight overall.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Huskies try for their third straight victory over the Wildcats in a Big East battle. Villanova won its first three conference games before dropping two of its last three. UConn claimed both meetings last season by a combined 20 points.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hawkeyes, winners of six of their past seven games, seek a better result when they host the No. 2 Boilermakers. A 25-point double-double from Zach Edey allowed Purdue to coast to an 87-68 triumph over Iowa to begin Big Ten play Dec. 4, 2023.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Huskies try for their third straight victory over the Wildcats in a Big East battle. Villanova won its first three conference games before dropping two of its last three. UConn claimed both meetings last season by a combined 20 points.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Trojans and Sun Devils meet for the final time in Arizona as Pac-12 adversaries. Arizona State snapped a seven-game series slide with a 77-72 upset in the 2023 Pac-12 Tournament quarterfinals. The programs have met regularly since 1979.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 17 Golden Eagles (12-5, 3-3 Big East) try to maintain their grip on the Red Storm (12-6, 4-3). Marquette has won four straight meetings. Junior guard Kam Jones (MARQ) averages 15.3 points per game and totaled 42 over his last two contests.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hawkeyes, winners of six of their past seven games, seek a better result when they host the No. 2 Boilermakers. A 25-point double-double from Zach Edey allowed Purdue to coast to an 87-68 triumph over Iowa to begin Big Ten play Dec. 4, 2023.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Huskies try for their third straight victory over the Wildcats in a Big East battle. Villanova won its first three conference games before dropping two of its last three. UConn claimed both meetings last season by a combined 20 points.

programme.desc: The Bulldogs (8-9, 0-6) and Friars (8-11, 2-4) try to get right in a Big East affair. Providence's four-game losing streak is one shy of Butler's current skid. The Bulldogs snapped a six-game slide against the Friars with a one-point win last season.
